intro: Tetradium taiwanense, commonly known as the Taiwan tetracarpellate, is a species of flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and smooth, reddish-brown bark. It typically grows in mountainous regions and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
